title: Can France's nuclear deterrent protect Europe?
summary: The idea of extending France's nuclear deterrent to its European allies is back on the agenda following Donald Trump's shift away from the continent. Emmanuel Macron said that he would open this debate.

title: Putin not opposed to Ukraine ceasefire, but has 'serious questions'
summary: Ukraine agreed to the plan during talks with US officials in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday, as US President Donald Trump pushes for a speedy end to the more than three-year conflict.

title: Trump threatens 200% tariff on wine, champagne from France, other EU countries
summary: The threat is retaliation against the bloc's planned levies on US-produced whiskey.

title: Pro-Palestinian protesters fill NY's Trump Tower
summary: Police said they arrested 98 people, marching under the banner of the group called Jewish Voice for Peace, for crimes including trespassing. The group, which caught security and police off guard, chanted 'fight Nazis, not students,' a reference to Trump's crackdown on foreign students involved in pro-Palestinian protests.

title: Demna, Gucci's gamble
summary: The Georgian designer has been entrusted by the Kering group with the reins of its flagship brand. At 43, Balenciaga's current creative director is tasked with revamping the aesthetic and turning the Florentine house's accounts around.

title: 'Adolescence,' the story of a British tragedy in four virtuosic one-shots
summary: Creator, writer and performer Stephen Graham; actress Erin Doherty; and director Philip Barantini talk about the genesis and making of the Netflix miniseries.

title: Chinese company Huawei suspected of bribing 15 MEPs
summary: On Thursday, March 13, Belgian police raided and arrested lobbyists working for the Chinese group. They are suspected of bribing MEPs, according to the daily newspaper 'Le Soir' and the investigative platform Follow the Money.

title: Trump takes US birthright citizenship to Supreme Court
summary: Birthright citizenship is enshrined in the 14th Amendment to the US Constitution, which decrees that anyone born on American soil is a citizen, and Trump's order seeks to end it for children whose parents are in the country illegally.

title: Who is Candace Owens, the pro-Trump influencer who is spreading transphobic fake news about Brigitte Macron?
summary: The conspiracy-theorist commentator, a figure of the American far right, has been working relentlessly to reactivate false information about the president's wife being transgender.

title: The Ukrainian soldiers trying to get well amid a relentless news cycle
summary: The Lissova-Poliana mental health center in Kyiv treats soldiers suffering from post-traumatic stress before they are sent back to the front. But the international instability caused by the Trump administration's involvement in the war isn't helping their recovery.

title: Germany's Merz urges MPs to back spending bonanza in fiery debate
summary: Merz's conservatives and the center-left Social Democrats – in talks to form a coalition after February's general election – unveiled the plans for vast extra outlays last week and are now racing to push them through the current legislation.

title: Americas to witness rare 'Blood Moon' total lunar eclipse
summary: A rare total lunar eclipse involves the Earth's umbra, the darkest part of the planet's shadow, covering the Moon.

title: European allies work on security guarantees for Ukraine
summary: Excluded for the time being from the negotiations between Washington, Moscow and Kyiv on a ceasefire, European defense leaders met in Paris on Wednesday to try to influence the process from a distance.

title: Zelensky hopes Washington will take 'strong measures' if Russia refuses ceasefire
summary: In the wake of the agreement signed in Jeddah with the United States, the Ukrainian president was careful to shift the blame for any potential failure of the American 30-day truce project onto Moscow.

title: The 'war economy' in France, from concept to reality
summary: Three years after the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the first results of the relocation and ramp-up of French defense industries are now visible. Yet some difficulties remain.

title: Germany prepares to mourn the loss of US nuclear protection
summary: In a country torn between its attachment to the transatlantic link and its hostility to nuclear weapons, Friedrich Merz, the likely future chancellor, has clearly called on Emmanuel Macron to open the debate on extending France's nuclear deterrent to Germany.

title: South African courts dismiss 'white genocide' myth
summary: According to some supremacist groups, white farmers are being murdered at higher rates than the rest of the population. This claim, however, is contradicted by the facts and by a new ruling handed down in February.

title: NASA postpones mission as stranded ISS astronauts wait
summary: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams have been stranded aboard the ISS since June after their Boeing Starliner spacecraft developed propulsion issues and was deemed unfit for their return. It came back empty.

title: Gene Hackman's estate asks court to block release of death investigation records
summary: The Oscar-winning actor died at age 95 from heart disease, with complications from Alzheimer's. His wife Betsy Arakawa, 65, was also found dead from natural causes, determined by medical investigators to have had a rare virus. Their partially mummified bodies were discovered at their New Mexico home last month.

title: How photographer Dennis Morris became a pop culture legend
summary: At the age of 13, he took one of the most famous pictures of Bob Marley. The Londoner went on to immortalize a whole pantheon of reggae and rock stars, from Lee 'Scratch' Perry to Oasis and the Sex Pistols. An exhibition at the Maison Européenne de la Photographie in Paris pays tribute to his work.

title: In Switzerland, trains run more slowly in the west
summary: Chronic under-investment or simple network overload? Journeys on the French-speaking side of Switzerland haven't been this long for decades. On the other hand, in German-speaking Switzerland, the network is expanding at breakneck speed.

title: Can Europe rearm and defend itself without the US?
summary: Making Europe capable of defending itself alone calls the use of American equipment into question. Governments will need to place solid orders over the next 20 years to achieve this goal.

title: Johns Hopkins University says ending 2,000 positions due to Trump cuts
summary: The cuts impact several key programs, including the university's medical school and school of public health, and Jhpiego, a global health non-profit organization founded at the university more than 50 years ago and which works to improve health in countries worldwide.

title: Top diplomats from G7 countries meet in Canada as Trump threatens more tariffs on US allies
summary: With the two-day meeting opening just after Trump threatened to impose 200% tariffs on European wine and other alcohol, the escalating trade war added to uncertainty over relations between the US and its closest allies, which have already been strained by Trump's position on Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: How the 'Korean cultural wave' conquered the planet
summary: South Korea is the example to follow when it comes to soft power: The country's music, cuisine and cosmetics are exported all over the world.

title: Stargazers enjoy dramatic 'Blood Moon', a total lunar eclipse
summary: Early on Friday morning, a rare 'Blood Moon' was visible in the Americas and Pacific and Atlantic oceans, as well as in the westernmost parts of Europe and Africa.

title: After Putin's 'yes, but' response to possible ceasefire, Trump shows signs of impatience
summary: The Russian president set a list of conditions for the truce called for by the US, while the US special envoy for Ukraine, Steve Witkoff, visited Moscow. Volodymyr Zelensky, meanwhile, denounced the Kremlin leader's 'manipulative words.'

title: 'In the event of a trade war with the US, Europe still has assets'
summary: If Donald Trump follows through on his threats of 25% tariffs against the European Union, the latter has serious retaliatory power due to its economic weight, argues Eric Albert, in his column.

title: French finance minister calls US-EU trade war 'idiotic'
summary: Finance Minister Eric Lombard reacted to US President Donald Trump's comments on imposing 200% tariffs on French and EU alcoholic beverages, as part of Trump's repeated tariff threats on both allies and adversaries.

title: Hamas prepared to free Israeli-US hostage, remains of four other dual nationals
summary: During indirect ceasefire talks in Doha, the Palestinian militants on Friday said they were 'ready to release the Israeli soldier Edan Alexander, who holds American citizenship, along with the remains of four others holding dual citizenship.'

title: Invite from Israeli government opens new chapter for French far-right party with anti-Semitic past
summary: Israel long considered Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National untouchable. But party chairman Jordan Bardella has been invited to speak at a conference in Jerusalem that will be concluded by Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Champagnes and European spirits risk becoming collateral damage in Trump's trade war
summary: The American president has threatened to impose 200% tariffs on these products in retaliation for defensive measures taken by the European Union. The French wine and spirits industry as sounded the alarm.

title: Quarrels at the top of the British far right
summary: Reform UK leader Nigel Farage has expelled one of the party's five MPs, Rupert Lowe, from his ranks, claiming to be the victim of a witch-hunt. Elon Musk has repeatedly called for Lowe to take Farage's place.

title: Finland sentences Russian neo-Nazi to life over Ukraine 'war crimes'
summary: Voislav Torden, a commander of the Russian neo-Nazi paramilitary group Rusich, was found guilty on Friday of 'four different war crimes' committed in the Luhansk region of eastern Ukraine.

title: France, Italy, UK order more air defense missiles
summary: The deal underscored 'the unwavering commitment of France, Italy and United Kingdom to bolster their air defense capabilities,' the countries said in a joint statement on Friday.

title: Volkswagen sells almost as many currywursts as cars
summary: Europe's leading carmaker saw its net profit fall by 30% in 2024, but sales of its curry sausage, produced since 1973 at its Wolfsburg site, hit a record high.

title: Germany’s Merz achieves breakthrough on massive spending plan
summary: The deal jointly proposed by the center-right CDU, whose leader Friedrich Merz is likely Germany's next chancellor, and center-left Social Democrats also calls for a €500 billion special fund for infrastructure spending.

title: Teen sentenced to 12 years for killing parents and setting fire to house
summary: The psychiatrists who examined 17-year-old Valentin unanimously deemed that his discernment was impaired at the time of the events, as he suffers from an autistic disorder, associated with depression and psychotic symptoms.

title: Ukraine negotiations: Putin and the weapon of time
summary: By imposing conditions that are unacceptable to Ukraine on the US ceasefire proposal, while at the same time asserting his desire for dialogue with Donald Trump, the Russian president is employing a tried and tested tactic: Buying time.

title: Le Pen visits Chad to capitalize on Macron's African failures
summary: The leader of the French far right, accompanied by her right-hand man Louis Aliot, will meet President Mahamat Idriss Déby. Her aim: To forge a 'presidential' stature.

title: Trump hails 'good and productive' US talks with Putin on Ukraine
summary: 'There is a very good chance that this horrible, bloody war can finally come to an end,' US President Donald Trump said, without further details.

title: Trump administration efforts to deport pro-Palestinian student spark further protests
summary: Mahmoud Khalil, a Syrian who legally resides in the US, was arrested for allegedly distributing leaflets praising Hamas and the October 7 terrorist attack.

title: Marc Carney sworn in as Canada's new prime minister
summary: The formal central banker, 59, replaces Justin Trudeau at a time when Canada is facing tariffs and annexation threats from US President Donald Trump.

title: LVMH to lift age limit, letting Bernard Arnault remain CEO until 85
summary: Bernard Arnault, 76, has yet to name a successor to lead the company in which his family controls 64.8% of the voting rights.

title: Alawites in Syrian town of Baniyas recount horror: 'The survivors are the ones Sunni families hid'
summary: In the Al-Qusour district, residents are trying to go back to their lives after the deadly attacks carried out by various factions between March 6 and 9. They describe days of hell during which many of their loved ones and neighbors were executed.

title: People evacuated and museums close in Tuscany amid flooding
summary: Torrential rains have caused Italian authorities to issue red alerts for parts of Tuscany and Emilia-Romagna. Dozens of people have been evacuated.

title: When Louboutin and Galliano fit perfectly together
summary: The shoemaker and the former artistic director of Maison Margiela co-designed a collection revisiting cult patterns from their respective houses. These include the Kate pumps and the Tabi ballerina flats.

title: Duterte follows ICC hearing via videolink
summary: The former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte attended a hearing at the International Criminal Court via videolink, appearing frail. He has been accused of crimes against humanity for his violent war on drugs.

title: Putin tells Ukraine troops in Russian region to 'surrender'
summary: Russia has mounted a rapid counteroffensive in the western border region of Kursk over the past week, recapturing much of the territory Ukraine seized in a shock incursion last August.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs pleads not guilty to new indictment
summary: Public allegations have been building against the former rap superstar since late 2023, when singer Cassie alleged Combs subjected her to more than a decade of coercion by physical force and drugs as well as a 2018 rape. Along with the federal criminal case, Combs faces a mountain of civil suits

title: US Congress clears key hurdle in bid to avert govt shutdown
summary: The Republican-led Senate muscled the legislation through a preliminary ballot that required Democratic cooperation to reach a 60-vote threshold – clearing it for final passage before the midnight deadline. Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer had shocked Democrats when announcing on Thursday evening he would back the Republican-drafted six-month funding proposal.
